event.title: 1759, in response to the destruction of the San Saba Mission, the Spanish led

data.event: In 1759, in response to the destruction of the San Saba Mission, the Spanish led an expedition against the Taovaya and their allies and attacked the twin villages.
(See Battle of the Twin Villages) The Taovaya villages were abandoned before 1841 as the Taovaya had been decimated by smallpox and encroachment by other Indians and Anglo-Americans.

event.title: acquired more than two-thirds of the land now

data.event: In the 1830s, the Choctaw tribe acquired more than two-thirds of the land now covered by Jefferson County, and the closely related Chickasaw tribe began to relocate there.

event.title: 1855, the two tribes formally divided and this area became

data.event: In 1855, the two tribes formally divided and this area became part of the Chickasaw Nation.
The western part of the present county became part of the Kiowa-Comanche-Apache Reservation, created by the 1867 Medicine Lodge Treaty.
